overview:
## Return Value

An initialized `PDFDestination` instance, or `NULL` if the object could not be initialized.

## Discussion

Specify `point` in page space. Typically, there’s no need to initialize destinations. Instead, you get them from [doc://com.apple.pdfkit/documentation/PDFKit/PDFAnnotationLink], [doc://com.apple.pdfkit/documentation/PDFKit/PDFOutline], or [doc://com.apple.pdfkit/documentation/PDFKit/PDFView] objects.

Page space is a 72-dpi coordinate system with the origin at the lower-left corner of the current page.

# init(page:at:)

**Initializer**

Initializes the destination.

## Declaration

```swift
init(page: PDFPage, at point: CGPoint)
```

```swift
init(page: PDFPage, at point: NSPoint)
```

## Parameters

- **page**: The page of the destination.
- **point**: The point of the destination, in page space.

## Return Value

An initialized `PDFDestination` instance, or `NULL` if the object could not be initialized.

## Discussion

Specify `point` in page space. Typically, there’s no need to initialize destinations. Instead, you get them from [doc://com.apple.pdfkit/documentation/PDFKit/PDFAnnotationLink], [doc://com.apple.pdfkit/documentation/PDFKit/PDFOutline], or [doc://com.apple.pdfkit/documentation/PDFKit/PDFView] objects.

Page space is a 72-dpi coordinate system with the origin at the lower-left corner of the current page.
title: init(page:at:)
